content:
• Friday, November 24, 2017
  • SFTBY

    Reuters: Uber to disclose SoftBank deal pricing next week

    • Moving forward with an investment deal with SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY), Uber (UBER) will disclose the pricing of the deal in formal tenders early next week, Reuters reports.
    • It's not yet known how much investors will be offered for shares or whether the price has been cut after the revelation of a data breach affecting 57M accounts.
    • Investors will have 20 business days to respond, according to the report.
    • The plan from SoftBank and Dragoneer Investment Group calls for $1B-$1.25B direct investment in Uber along with buying up to 17% of shares held by existing investors/employees. That direct investment will maintain Uber's valuation of about $68B.
    • SoftBank shares rose 2.4% in today's U.S. trading session.
    • Previously: Uber breach may shake Softbank deal (Nov. 23 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: CYTK +3.9%. PAA +3.7%. SOGO +1.7%. REDU +1.2%. ACHN +0.9%.
    • Top losers: ENDP -1.7%. CBI -1.6%. XNET -1.4%. SJT -1.3%. AKCA -1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 7 Comments
  • M

    Macy's sees untimely payment-processing problems on key retail day

    • After reports on social media that customers were having issues with credit card payments today, Macy's (NYSE:M) says it's adding personnel to resolve the issue.
    • "It is taking longer than usual to process some credit and gift cards in our stores, but we had added additional associates to the floor who are working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible," a spokesperson says.
    • Shares are down 0.4% postmarket; they had gained 2.1% in the shortened session on optimism for a strong Black Friday for the retailer.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 68 Comments
  • CYTX

    Cytori Therapeutics closes oversubscribed rights offering

    • Cytori Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CYTX) announced the expiration of a rights offering that it says was oversubscribed by more than 75%.
    • It expects to raise full gross proceeds of $10M.
    • The company offered units at $1,000 each; with 17,700 subscriptions, participants will be pro-rated down to the total offering of 10,000 units.
    • Shares ticked up 7.5% during today's short post-holiday session.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • SBAC

    SBA Communications a top pick at New Street

    • SBA Communications (NASDAQ:SBAC) closed the shortened session up 1.6% after being named a top pick at New Street, which gave the tower operator a Street-high price target.
    • Expansion and a return to organic growth at Sprint is a key catalyst, writes analyst Spencer Kurn. That development should help Crown Castle (NYSE:CCI) more, Kurn says, but that stock trades at an "unwarranted premium" to SBA and American Tower (NYSE:AMT). (h/t Bloomberg)
    • SBAC's discount will narrow as it compounds adjusted funds from operations faster and sees better returns on invested capital.
    • New Street's price target on SBAC is boosted to $215 from $190, implying 27% upside from today's closing price.
    • Also higher today: CCI +0.8%; AMT +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 5 Comments

  • SVM

    Silvercorp to buy back 5% of outstanding equity

    • Silvercorp Metals (SVM +2.4%) is higher after saying it will repurchase ~8.4M of its common shares, or ~5% of outstanding stock, over the next year.
    • SVM believes market conditions have kept its shares undervalued relative to the immediate and long term value of its portfolio of producing properties in China and other strategic investments.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 7 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: MARA +104%. GROW +37%. RIOT +33%. NETE +31%. SSC-OLD +22%. AHPI +21%. OPHC +20%. ARCW +20%. SRAX +18%. GCAP +18%.

  • TSM

    TSMC announces machinery equipment purchase

    • Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (NYSE:TSM) announces purchasing $33.37M worth of machinery equipment from Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX).  
    • Taiwan Semiconductor shares are up 1.2%.
    • Lam Research shares are up 0.8%. 
    • Previously: Digitimes: Apple cuts microLED research team (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 15 Comments

  • Healthcare Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: RIOT +30%. AMPE +19%.AHPI +17%. ASMB +15%. CRVS +15%.

  • MDIUY

    Telecom Italia continues talks with Mediaset, but Vivendi settlement far off

    • Telecom Italia (TI +5.2%) managers are in Milan to move along talks with Mediaset (OTCPK:MDIUY) on a television deal that would involve providing content to Tim Vision, according to Rome newspaper Il Messaggero.
    • Tim Vision (a joint venture between TI and Vivendi's Canal Plus) would get content in a deal that could pay €600M to Mediaset -- and help take a step toward settling litigation between Vivendi (VIVHY +2%) and Mediaset.
    • Meanwhile, those two companies are not close to resolving that litigation, Mediaset's CFO tells Reuters.
    • A court hearing is set for Dec. 19, and while lawyers are talking, "nothing arrived at board level yet," says Mediaset CFO Marco Giordani.
    • The content deal between Tim Vision and Mediaset could be closed by that Dec. 19 hearing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • SSI

    Mall names jump on Black Friday

    • Retail movers on Black Friday include Stages Stores (SSI +5%), Chico's FAS (CHS +3.1%), The Children's Place (PLCE +2%), Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +2.6%), Ascena Retail Group (ASNA +1.8%), DSW (DSW +2.3%), Express (EXPR +1.3%), Stitch Fix (SFIX +5.8%), American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +1.5%) and Gap (GPS +2%).
    • Previously: Retail stocks gain as Black Friday heats up (Nov. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 15 Comments
  • WFT

    Reuters: Weatherford hires advisers to sell assets

    • Weatherford International (WFT +2.9%) opens higher following a Reuters report that the oilfield services company has appointed advisers including Morgan Stanley to sell assets starting in Q1 2018.
    • WFT is looking to sell its artificial lift business, its wellheads and drilling tools units, and international pressure pumping assets, according to the report, which cites banking sources.
    • The report says potential bidders for the pressure pumping assets could include Superior Energy Services (SPN -0.2%), Canada's Calfrac (OTCPK:CFWFF) and P-E backed energy funds.
    • WFT put its land drilling business valued at below $1B on sale last year but failed to make a deal; this time around, the company could try to sell the business in pieces based on regional operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 9 Comments
  • BASFY

    BASF in talks to merge oil and gas unit with Fridman’s DEA

    • BASF (OTCQX:BASFY +4.1%) says its Wintershall oil and gas unit is in talks to merge with DEA, the energy firm owned by Russian billionaire Mikhail Fridman.
    • BASF says it would hold the majority of the shares in the joint enterprise if an agreement is reached, adding that an IPO would be an option in the medium-term.
    • Wintershall accounts for ~8% of BASF's operating profit YTD and in 2016, down from more than 20% in 2015, and its YTD adjusted operating earnings totaled €533M ($632.5M) in the first nine months of this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • ASX

    Chinese regulators approve Advanced Semiconductor Engineering merger

    • China’s antitrust regulator approves the merger between Advanced Semiconductor Engineering (NYSE:ASX) and Siliconware Precision Industry Limited.
    • The Ministry of Commerce did include some preconditions. The companies can become subsidiaries of a holding company and need to remain independent in management, operations, and financials for two years.
    • The resulting entity will have a market capitalization of $16.17B.
    • Advanced Semiconductor Engineering says it expects to receive shareholder approval in February.  
    • Advanced Semiconductor shares are up 4.3% premarket.   
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am

    • MARA +53%.
    • SSC-OLD +22%.
    • SRAX +15%.
    • RIOT +15% as the transition to a blockchain player continues to attract investors.

    | 9:18 AM | 3 Comments
  • YNDX

    Yandex +3.8% on approval to merge with Uber in Russia

    • Shares in Yandex (NASDAQ:YNDX) are up 3.8% premarket after the search engine company got antimonopoly approval to merge its ride-sharing business with that of Uber (UBER) in Russia.
    • Regulator FAS said the companies could combine businesses but not block drivers from working for rivals. They expect combining driver apps will improve service overall for Yandex.Taxi and Uber app users.
    • The two companies have been working for months on a joint venture where Yandex would own 59.3% and contribute $100M to Uber's $225M.
    • The deal's set to close in January.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am

    • MDGS -17% on pricing $1.6M registered direct offering.
    • QD -10% on adjusting APR of credit services on the Alipay Consumer Interface.
    • NKTR -5% on Amikacin Inhale program in collaboration with Bayer failing to meet primary endpoint of superiority.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 4 Comments
  • HMNY

    MoviePass owner works out deal with PayPal

    • Helios & Matheson Analytics (NASDAQ:HMNY) says it has agreed to guarantee the financial obligations of MoviePass to PayPal as part of a commercial agreement between the two companies.
    • SEC Form 8-K
    • Shares of Helios & Matheson are up 4.35% premarket to $13.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 22 Comments
  • RIOT

    Rocket ride for Riot Blockchain continues

    • Riot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT) is up 16% in premarket action as the company's transition to a blockchain player continues to attract investors.
    • In a notable move last week, Riot added former Invesco CEO Frank Bishop to its advisory board.
    • Shares of Riot Blockchain have more than doubled over the last week amid the ongoing lust of investors for pure play crypto stocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 35 Comments
  • JCP

    Retail stocks gain as Black Friday heats up

    • Retail stocks are slightly ahead of U.S. stock index futures on the busiest mall shopping day of the year. Customer Growth Partners tells CNBC that traffic this year is "exceptional" based on its checks of 20 locations in the U.S. A solid day could be in store with weather decent across most major metropolitan areas and consumer confidence readings blazing hot. Earlier today, Adobe reported that Thanksgiving day online sales were up a double-digit clip.
    • Some investors are paying attention to the retail traffic reports. Shares of J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) are up 1.86% in premarket trading, while department store peers Kohl's (NYSE:KSS), Macy's (NYSE:M) and Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) are all up around 1%.
    • Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) is up 0.41% and Target (NYSE:TGT) is 0.54% higher heading into the holiday-shortened trading day. Both retail chain are seeing good traffic tips analysts that braved the graveyard shift.
    • Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) is showing a 0.92% gain as investors continue to snap up shares following the post-earnings plunge.
    • The retail sector has outperformed the broad stock market for the two-week period surrounding Black Friday over the last ten years.
    • ETFs: XLY, XRT, VCR, RTH, RETL, FDIS, FXD, RCD, PMR, FTXD, CNDF, EMTY, JHMC.
    • Previously: Thanksgiving shopping puts retail on watch (Nov. 23)
    • Previously: Thanksgiving online sales pass $1.5B (Nov. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM | 40 Comments
  • AVGO

    Broadcom could interfere with Qualcomm's NXP bid

    • The New York Post reports Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) CEO Hock Tan could interfere with Qualcomm’s (NASDAQ:QCOM) acquisition of NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI).
    • Sources say Tan told Qualcomm shareholders that Broadcom would increase its buyout offer if Qualcomm drops the NXP effort. 
    • Broadcom offered $70 per share for Qualcomm, which was rejected, and sources say the company could go up to $77 if the NXP acquisition drops. Qualcomm insiders have signaled wanting at least $80. 
    • Qualcomm offered $110 per share for NXP last December. Regulatory delays have given activist investors time to push for more money. 
    • Without the NXP acquisition, Qualcomm stands in a more vulnerable position for a takeover.   
    • Qualcomm shares are up 1% premarket. 
    • NXP shares are down 0.72%.   
    • Previously: Qualcomm +1.7% on report Broadcom may add stock to bid (Nov. 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM | 67 Comments
  • NTNX

    RBC Capital raises its Nutanix price target

    • RBC Capital Markets raises its Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX) price target from $34 to $37 and maintains an Outperform rating.
    • Firm considers valuation reasonable as analysts and investors watch for opportunity related to the shift to software. 
    • Nutanix shares are up 1.9% premarket.  
    • Previously: Needham initiates Nutanix at Buy (Nov. 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM | 13 Comments
  • BAYRY

    Phase III study with Amikacin Inhale fails to meet primary endpoint of superiority

    • Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) announces that INHALE, a global Phase III clinical study program investigating Amikacin Inhale in addition to standard of care in intubated and mechanically ventilated patients with Gram-negative pneumonia, did not demonstrate superiority versus standard of care plus aerosolized placebo.
    • The primary outcome measure was survival at day 28-32. Secondary outcome measures included pneumonia-related mortality through to day 28-32, early clinical response up to day 10, number of days on mechanical ventilation up to day 28-32, and number of intensive care unit days up to day 28-32. Efficacy and safety analyses from this study will be published in due course.
    • The primary endpoint, as well as secondary endpoints were similar in both treatment arms, and were therefore not met.
    • Amikacin Inhale is the development name of an integrated drug-device combination, consisting of a specially formulated Amikacin Inhalation Solution and a proprietary Synchronized Inhalation System with a vibrating mesh nebulizer.
    • The Amikacin Inhale program is being developed through a collaboration with Nektar Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NKTR).
    • Shares of (NKTR) are down 6% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM
  • PDYPF

    Paddy Power Betfair also circling CrownBet

    • Paddy Power Betfair (OTC:PDYPF, OTCPK:PDYPY) has held talks with CrownBet about a merger, according to Channel NewsAsia.
    • The company joins William Hill in making a bid for the Crown Resorts Ltd. (OTCPK:CWLDF, OTCPK:CWLDY) property.
    • Shares of Paddy Power Betfair are up 3.3% in London trading.
    • Previously: William Hill in merger talks with CrownBet (Nov. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 AM
  • MDGS

    Medigus prices $1.6M registered direct offering

    • Medigus (NASDAQ:MDGS) announces that it has entered into definitive agreements with several institutional investors providing for the issuance of an aggregate of 810,000 ADS at a purchase price of $2.00 per ADS in a registered direct offering.
    • Additionally, the Company will issue unregistered warrants to purchase up to 405,000 ADSs. The warrants will have a term of 5.5 years, be exercisable commencing six months following the issuance date and have an exercise price of $2.25 per ADS.
    • Expected gross proceeds from the offering will be ~$1.6M.  Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes.
    • The closing of the sale of the securities is November 28.
    • Shares are down 9% premarket on modest volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:04 AM
